text:
Apollo 14 astronaut Edgar Mitchell, who became the sixth man on the moon when he and Alan Shepard helped NASA recover from Apollo 13’s “successful failure” has died in Florida. He was 85.

Mitchell died on Thursday night at a West Palm Beach hospice after a short illness, his daughter, Kimberly Mitchell, said. Mitchell’s passing coincides with the 45th anniversary of the Apollo 14 mission, which ran from Jan. 31 – Feb. 9, 1971. The Apollo 14 mission was Mitchell’s only trip in space. — AP
title: Sixth astronaut to walk on the moon dies at 85
